definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

sentences.english: Usual Englishman or Englishwoman can indicate the road for you on the street.
sentences.chinese: 通常英國人在街上是會給你指路的。

sentences.english: In 12, a lofty ideal is a beacon of life.
sentences.chinese: 高尚的理想是人生的指路明燈。

sentences.english: They will care for the sick, collect the rubbish, guard homes and offices, and give directions on the street.
sentences.chinese: 它們會照顧病人，收集垃圾，看家護院，上街指路。

sentences.english: A smiling volunteer on crutches shows the way at Beijing's Xidan intersection.
sentences.chinese: 西單路口殘疾人志願者，拄着雙柺微笑指路。

sentences.english: Learn some words about places some prep. and adv. How to give directions.
sentences.chinese: 學習地點的一些單詞，介詞和副詞，如何指路。

sentences.english: If you lose your way, Your forever friend guides you and cheers you on.
sentences.chinese: 當你迷失方向時，你永遠的朋友爲你指路，讓你振作。

sentences.english: But if's we're lucky the good lord sends someone to bring us home.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果我們幸運的話，上帝會爲我們帶來指路人。

sentences.english: Englishwoman can indicate the road for you on the street.
sentences.chinese: 通常英國人在街上是會給你指路的。

sentences.english: But there are guideposts that can help point the way out.
sentences.chinese: 但是，幫助指路的路標還是有的。

sentences.english: R. has their gaze fixed upon the age of the Roman Empire as the beacon of cultural salvation.
sentences.chinese: 特別關注古羅馬帝國，將其作爲文化拯救的指路明燈。

sentences.english: Your emotions are your guiding light, but of course you aren't infallible.
sentences.chinese: 你的情緒是你的指路明燈，但你當然並非十全十美。

sentences.english: My dear sir, upon no account in the world; my father can direct me.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的先生，那可使不得，我父親會給我指路的。

sentences.english: Who like to show your road map?
sentences.chinese: 教師讓兩組學生上來邊畫路線圖，邊指路。

sentences.english: Police even gave directions to some of the protestors who were looking for the rally.
sentences.chinese: 警察甚至爲一些尋找聚會地的抗議者指路。

definition: to ask for directions/to ask the way (to some place)
to lead the way/to guide/to show the way/fig. to instruct
to lose the way/lost/labyrinth/labyrinthus vestibularis (of the inner ear)
to dispel doubts/to clear up confusion
to point out/to indicate/to give directions/to show how (to do sth)/to censure/to pick at
to open up a path/to make one's way through/to construct a road/(electricity) open circuit
to make a detour/to take the long route
